data.title: New Terminal and Kill Terminal do not work as expected with Tmux setup

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #33274

- Set up tmux as explained in https://medium.com/@joaomoreno/persistent-terminal-sessions-in-vs-code-8fc469ed6b41

With this set up, New terminal and Kill terminal commands are not working.
After clicking New terminal action, label of the terminal gets lost.

data.title: Closing style tag highlighted incorrectly
data.body: Testing: #33292 See screen shot: The `<` of the closing tag is not rendered correctly

data.title: new VS Code icon doesn't look right in Windows Open dialog
data.body:
ref #33272:

When double clicking on workspace file on Windows I get this dialog:

![2017-08-29_12-58-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1898161/29822432-b84cb874-8ccb-11e7-889e-46745c6e5a07.png)

The icon doesn't look right in this context.

data.title: Some git actions ask me for the repo, some assume automatically
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. MR workspace with multiple git repositories
2. command palette > git pull I am presented a choice from which repo to pull from -> makes sense
3. Have changes in each repo, command palette > git stage  I am **not** presented a choice but git automagically picks a repository for which to stage

I think we should be consistent here and always ask if an action is being exectued from the command palette

data.title: JS errors in HTML aren't prefixed with [html] neither with [js]

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Testing #33292 Usually we set a source on diagnostics to indicated which LS did generate and error. We should either prefix JS errors in HTML script tags with [html] or [js]

data.title: Git: Git model not found
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Have a MR workspace with multiple git folders
2. Command palette > git pull > you are presented options to choose from, hit `esc` instead
3. Error Git: Git model not found

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 15 00 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29822200-f40a18a8-8cca-11e7-9828-a9ea004764c6.png)

data.title: Git status bar not specific enough
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Have a MR workspace with multiple folders with git repositories
2. Notice that the status bar show the branch for the last active git repository which I think makes sense
3. However after some time I might forget what was my last active repo and then it is very unclear what does the sync command do

The minimal step would be to add some hover help and for the warning message to actually say for what repository the actions is being performed.
A better solution would be to always show for which repository the branch label and the sync action are applied.

In my example below it could say
`vscode-docs: vnext`

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 14 59 05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29822101-9d461922-8cca-11e7-961c-e369ad2dec13.png)

data.title: Empty path in the folders should be ignored
[visualforce] Add validation of HTML, CSS, Javascript to Visualforce pages

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I notice that we don't have JavaScript intelisense on Visualforce pages.
Will be good to have all html features like css, javascript helpers and HTML snippets on visualforce pages without the needing to change the language mode to HTML.

Thank you

data.title: Cannot open a workspace when there is a empty folder entry
Do not show invalid or not existing folders
Git: Cannot read property 'resourceUri' of undefined
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Have a MR workspace with multiple folders having git
2. Try to stage iles in the third folder (in my case newly initiated repository with 10 files)
3. Seldomly I get `Git: Cannot read property 'resourceUri' of undefined`

I tried stopping on an exception but it does not stop so sorry for not providing more data. I believe you can easily repro it

data.title: Show the workspace configuration file when opening VS Code from workspace file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #33278

- Have a workspace configuration file on disk
- Double click on it to open
- VS Code opens the workspace which is good

It will be also good to show the file when the workspace is open. Also true when user drags and drop the workspace configuration file.

data.title: Consider using only one commit input field instead of multiple
data.body:
refs: #33267

1. Have a MR workspace with multiple folders each having git
2. Notice that for each of these we duplicate the commit input field.
3. Due to this duplication we are loosing valuable screen space and it looks ugly on top of that

I propose that we only have one input field which would live on the top, seperated from the rest of the panes. This way the viewlet would be cleaner and nicer imho

data.title: Git viewlet not reacting on creation / deletion of git folder
data.body:
Refs: #33267

1. Have two folders in your MR workspace
2. First folder should have a git folder, second not
3. Outside of vscode initialize a git repository in the second folder
4. VSCode is not picking this up. Deleting the .git folder is also not being picked up

data.title: Not possible to hide SCM panes in split view
data.body:
Refs: #33267

In the explorer and debug viewlet it is possible to hide specific sections of the split view.
However that is not the case in the git viewlet.
I would expect this to work both for consistency and because a user might not be interested in SCM control for one of the folders he has in his workspace.

data.title: scripts\test.bat can't be executed in integrated terminal. Progress dots aren't rendered
data.body:
Testing: #33274 

- vscode workspace
- compile
- execute scripts\test.bat in integrated terminal

Observe: no dots are printed to show progress

- Do the same in HyperJS. Observe: dots are printed.

data.title: Initialize size of split views in SCM should be equal
data.body:
#33267

1. Have a mr workspace with two workspaces each having git support
2. Notice the inital layout of views in the SCM viewlet is not equal. The second workspace just gets around 20% of space
3. Doing some changes in the second workspace will leave the split view very small. Due to that I believe they should be the same size to start with. This way it is easier for user to not discover that we support git in a MR environment

![screen shot 2017-08-29 at 14 22 47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/29820669-8e00e5dc-8cc5-11e7-8f51-8fc2d72cb8a1.png)

data.title: Terminal has scroll bar after second launch allowing to scroll away inside buffers

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Testing: #33274 Windows, PowerShell - open terminal - start nano on a file Observer: the terminal has no scroll bar - close nano - start nano again Observe: the terminal has a scroll bar and user can scroll

data.title: Terminal app doesn't resize if pane resizes
data.body: Testing #33274 Windows, Powershell - open terminal - start nano - resize the panel not the window Observer: the terminal and nano inside doesn't resize. It does if I resize the window.

data.title: Call `registerDebugConfigurationProvider` when adding a new config?

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
re #33248

I wonder if we should call `registerDebugConfigurationProvider` of all providers when the "Add Configuration" button in the lower right of `launch.json` is clicked. That would help me with existing launch.json-files.

data.title: Terminal doesn't show / open
data.body: Testing: #33274 I was not able to consistently reproduce this but sometimes the terminal / prompt didn't show up when opening the integrated terminal.

data.title: Diff blocks for 300 ms when continusly changing a large file outside of vscode

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Refs: #33302

1. Download [Lending Club data for Q3 2016](https://www.lendingclub.com/info/download-data.action)
2. Open that file in vscode, have the following node program running
3. VSCode freezes (window is no longer responding)

If i turn on word wrap vscode crasesh with out of memory

```js
var fs = require('fs');
setInterval(() => fs.appendFileSync('message.txt', 'data to append'), 500);
```

data.title: Outside edit operations get merged into one when undoing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Refs: #33302

1. Have a file in vscode
2. Make an edit to that file in some other editor and save.
3. After some time make some other edit in the same file also in some other editor and save
4. Go back to vscode and undo, both edits from 2 and 3 get undone. In a perfect world the first undo would undo step 3 and only the second undo woul undo step 2.

Not a big deal imho

data.title: EH Debugging: breakpoints not hit in JavaScript
data.body:
testing #33305 on Windows:

- create **JavaScript** hello world extension
- set breakpoints in lines 3, 11, 16, 20, 25
- press "F5" and wait until EH windows appears and is ready
- run "Hello" action

Observe: 
sometimes no breakpoint is hit, or only breakpoint on line 20 is hit.
I was never able to break on any other breakpoint.

data.title: Unsaved file does not detect underlying file changes
data.body:
Refs: #33302

1. Have auto save off, make changes to a file.
2. Open the same file in some other editor and make changes to it and save
3. Go back to vscode and save your original changes. Notice that the saved changes from step 2 get overwritten. I would expect I get some conflict dialog

data.title: Debug: breakpoint for JS extension not hit until second invocation
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. generate a JS extension (JS!)
2. add breakpoint where the hello world info message is triggered

=> only after invoking the hello world command a second time is the breakpoint hit for me (macOS, todays insider build)

data.title: Retain the selection after tree refresh

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. install docker extension
2. click with the mouse into the contributed explorer

=> focus is shortly removed out of the view
=> focus should stay so that keyboard interaction is possible

![flicker_chrome58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/29816438-4ff0bdc8-8cb4-11e7-8310-dc09a9663701.gif)
